answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!It is possible to feel tremors all over the body. Tremors are often associated with drugs, alcohol, smoking, lack of sleep, stress and fatigue. They can be seen in peripheral neuropathies of diabetes, in hyperthyroidism, parasomnia, multiple sclerosis, TIAs or transient ischemic attacks or mini strokes, hypoglycemia, disorders of calcium metabolism, hyperparathyroidism etc. The jolting pains can be due Vit D or Vit B12 deficiency, ankylosing spondylitis causing multiple pinched nerves, or due to sciatica which happens due to pinched sacral nerve root.Consult an internal medicine specialist or your PCP. Discuss these possibilities with your doctor. It is difficult to comment beyond this without examining. A comprehensive investigation is required keeping all the points in mind. Hope this helps. Take care!

question: Hello, I have been experiencing many strange and scary symptoms for about the last 4 months!  It all started after I got a sinus infection which then the anitbiotics gave me a yeast infection and then the symptoms started.. Extreme fatigue, muscle weakness(cannot walk up a flight of stairs without sitting) folding laundry is hard, holding my daughter!  I get massive muscle tremors all over the body!  I also feel body vibrations and can feel vibrations through electrical equipment ten fold!! I get muscle spasms in legs mostly but all muscles at the same time.  I will wake up and go to walk and my toes feel broken!  My achilles tendon feels pulled some days.  I get electrical shocks mostly when I'm cold.  All my tendons hurt where they meet the joints.  My eyesight goes blurry off and on, and I am now getting around 10 eye twitches an hour, my ears are clogged all the time, I still have fluid in my sinuses and have a dry cough that won't go away.  I have a lot of pain in arms, feet, hands, legs, stiff neck and new headaches.  I cannot stretch my legs at all it is very painful!  I have now had a swollen right hand for no reason for the last 7 weeks!  The symptoms get way worse with less sleep.  The list goes on!  I have had blood work done which came back normal and x-rays on most my joints which show no signs of arthritis.  Now I'm having a hard time getting into see my doctor because of work schedule!  Can anybody help me figure out what's wrong with me? I'm only 33 and normally healthy, I just want to feel normal again!
title: extreme muscle weakness
